results.title: We used to call them Blackboys
results.creator_credit: Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE and Maz McGann
results.brief_description: Using photographic images, this story of the grass trees growing on the ranges outside Wangaratta becomes a poetic meditation on how a person’s ideas on place can change with understanding and compassion. European insensitivity and ignorance of the past has been replaced with political awareness and correctness, a sense of the land and the environment and a desire for reconciliation with those who belonged to the land before the invasion of the white man. A sensitive and thought-provoking piece. Made as part of Regional Arts Victoria’s Bute Utes - the Movie program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE and Maz McGann

group_siblings.title: Road trip: after the Gippsland bushfires 2003

results.title: Road trip: after the Gippsland bushfires 2003
results.brief_description:
A road trip through the East Gippsland region of Victoria after the bushfires in 2003 and a chance meeting at a place called Seldom Seen, somewhere between Jindabyne and Buchan, with David Woodburn owner of the “Seldom Seen Service Statiion”. David talks of his encounter with the fires, his loss of his family home, the service station and many of his pet animals including an emu and an ostrich. But it is David’s eccentricity and sardonic humour, along with the wonderful quirky photographic shots that makes this story so engaging and appealing.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Op shops of our town
results.brief_description: An amusing ‘mockumentary’ on several of the Op Shops in the East Gippsland region. This tongue-in-cheek journey introduces us to the eccentricities of op-shopping, the people who run them, the people who shop in them, and the eclectic mix of goods found in them. Stars Mr Kearney and Ms Jennian, with thanks to the following participating Op Shops - Paynesville Op Shop and Uniting Church, Lakes Entrance Ambulance, Salvos and St Vincents in Bairnsdale. Music from the fabulous Stereophonic Optigan, written and played by Mr Kearney. Camera - Jeremy Johnson.

results.title: My grandfather's country
results.creator_credit: Lisa Roberts, Edie Terrick, Poogie Hayes and Elaine Terrick
results.brief_description:
Elaine Terrick’s mum, Edie Terrick, takes a journey back to the place she calls her grandfather’s country - in the mountainous ranges of Gippsland, Victoria. A place where her grandfather survived the slaughtering of his aboriginal people and where he as an abandoned child was found by white people - the O’Rourke family - taken in and brought up as an O’Rourke. For Edie it is an emotional but rewarding journey. Contains beautiful images of the high country and of the “place” where Edi’s grandfather grew up.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: A Magic place
results.creator_credit: Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE, Linton Briggs, Kathy Whelan and David Briggs
results.brief_description:
Narrated to a background of archival home movie images juxtaposed with contemporary images of Lake Mokoan and the surrounding landscape, local resident Linton Briggs gives his account of the changes which have taken place since the decommissioning of the Lake. He speaks of a magic place, Winton Swamp, where wildlife was in abundance, where a wet-land ecosystem of bird-life, Murray cod, Red-gums, and every variety of duck imaginable used to exist and of his sadness and apprehension the changing of the lake may make to the ecological balance of Lake Mokoan.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Darren's day out
results.brief_description:
A journey through Darren’s colorful Koori paintings of Gippsland. His images depict his visit to Metung rocks, Kalimna and an Emu Farm, and through text, Darren conveys his thoughts and impressions of his day out.
No dialogue only baclground sound effects.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Boppo's bike ride
results.creator_credit: South West Institute of TAFE, Allan Parker, Yaraan Bundle and Ivan Couzens
results.brief_description:
A grandfather/grandaughter collaboration, this is one man’s journey through place and time from the 1930s-1960s. Ivan Couzens reminisces about the days when riding a bike was the only way to get around; school was a five mile ride away; and when he started work at the Bluestone quarries, the bicycle was his only mode of transport. A light-hearted look at the past interspersed with photographs and images of places once travelled. Music: “Greenflower” by Rob Bundle.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.
